task.title: Create a Bar Chart
task.shortdesc: This task demonstrates how to create a bar chart using Python and Matplotlib.

step.info: This command imports the necessary library for creating plots in Python.
This step defines the categories and values for the bar chart.

step.cmd: Create the Bar Plot using the plt.bar() function
step.stepresult: The bar chart is now created using the categories and values defined earlier.

step.cmd: Add a Title to the Plot using the plt.title() function
step.stepresult: A title is added to the bar chart.

step.cmd: Add Axis Labels using the plt.xlabel() and plt.ylabel() functions
step.stepresult: Labels for the X and Y axes are added to the chart.

step.cmd: Customize the bar color to Blue, using color in plt.bar()
step.stepresult: The color of the bars in the chart is changed to blue.

step.cmd: Display the Plot using plt.show() again
step.stepresult: The final chart with the blue bars is displayed again.
The final version of the bar chart is displayed below.

stepxmp.codeblock:
# Final complete code import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
categories = ['A', 'B', 'C', 'D', 'E'] values = [10, 20, 15, 25, 30]
plt.bar(categories, values, color='blue') plt.title('Bar Chart Example') plt.xlabel('Categories') plt.ylabel('Values') plt.show()
